messages.content: My name is Paul Healey and I was a Conservative councillor, and Deputy Leader, in York for eight years. I recently left to join the Liberal Democrats and I wanted to explain why.

issues.brexitEurope: During the 2016 EU Referendum, like many fellow Conservative voters, and a majority of people across York, I decided to vote Remain.
issues.economy: The Party I joined would not have led us so far down the path towards crashing out of the EU, risking huge damage to our jobs, economy and our public services.

community.content: I believe local communities and public services are of vital importance.

endorsements.endorsement: I have seen his commitment and dedication first hand and I have no hesitation in recommending that you vote for Keith for a sensible, pragmatic voice in Parliament.

quotes.text: The Liberal Democrats have their best opportunity to win in York Outer since the seat's creation in 2010. In the process beating Boris Johnson's no deal Brexiteer and the Corbynite far-left socialist candidates.

examples: During the 2016 EU Referendum, like many fellow Conservative voters, and a majority of people across York, I decided to vote Remain.
I believe local communities and public services are of vital importance.
I felt moderate, liberal, and pro-European members and voters, such as myself, had been abandoned.
In desperation to neutralise the Nigel Farage effect, the Conservative Party has forsaken its principles.
The Party I joined would not have led us so far down the path towards crashing out of the EU, risking huge damage to our jobs, economy and our public services.
Boris Johnson, a more unqualified person you would struggle to find.
I have seen his commitment and dedication first hand and I have no hesitation in recommending that you vote for Keith for a sensible, pragmatic voice in Parliament.
The Liberal Democrats have put forward someone that cares deeply about the communities of our city and will work tirelessly to improve the lives of everyone living in York Outer.
I believe local communities and public services are of vital importance.
During the 2016 EU Referendum, like many fellow Conservative voters, and a majority of people across York, I decided to vote Remain.
The Party I joined would not have led us so far down the path towards crashing out of the EU, risking huge damage to our jobs, economy and our public services.
In the process beating Boris Johnson's no deal Brexiteer and the Corbynite far-left socialist candidates.
I have seen his commitment and dedication first hand and I have no hesitation in recommending that you vote for Keith for a sensible, pragmatic voice in Parliament.
In desperation to neutralise the Nigel Farage effect, the Conservative Party has forsaken its principles.
Boris Johnson, a more unqualified person you would struggle to find.

Having worked opposite Keith on the Council for eight years, and alongside him for the past couple of months I have seen his commitment and dedication first hand and I have no hesitation in recommending that you vote for Keith for a sensible, pragmatic voice in Parliament.
